mng: a wooden or bamboo pen for sheep or cattle, wood or bamboo trestlework, a warehouse

exm.mng: a wooden or bamboo pen for sheep or cattle, wood or bamboo trestlework, a warehouse
plank walkway constructed on the face of a cliff, (archaic) elevated passageway connecting the upper levels of adjacent towers
a pier, a landing-stage, a loading trestle for goods or passengers, a platform

lit. repair the plank road by day while secretly crossing the Wei river 渭河 at Chencang (idiom, refers to a stratagem used by Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 in 206 BC against Xiangyu 項羽|项羽 of Chu); fig. fein one thing while doing another, to cheat under cover of a diversion
exm.pyn: míng xiū zhàn dào , àn dù Chén cāng

exm.mng: to be reluctant to give up a post
cargo receipt, landing account, warehouse or storage receipt
an incompetent man clings to a good position (idiom)
